sentences: Maxim Saury (February 27, 1928 â€“ November 15, 2012) was a French jazz clarinetist and bandleader.
Shortly after World War II he began playing with Christian Azzi and Claude Bolling and briefly led a trio in 1949.
In the 1950s he founded the New Orleans Sound, which included Jean-Claude Naude, and went on several tours worldwide.
He played with Barney Bigard in the U.S. in the late 1960s and returned the U.S. twice in the 1970s.

As a representative figure in French traditional jazz, he was frequently invited to play music, or the role of a musician, in film and television, including in Bonjour Tristesse, Les Tricheurs, Mon oncle, and Adieu Philippine.
